column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Control a Robot ’s
#Text=Motion using Linear Actuators
#Text=Linear actuators are popularly used in robotic applications .
#Text=They are designed to help the robot to perform complex motions .
#Text=While there are advanced methods of using the linear actuator for robotic movements , this is a simple method that one can try .
#Text=As linear actuators require an external power source , you will require a DC motor with an attached gearbox .
#Text=You will also need a servo motor controller and a micro controller .
#Text=Other general tools include a drill , an aluminum sheet , fasteners , and four small wheels .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide on the Primary Attributes .
#Text=The first thing you need to do is decide on the actuator ’s primary characteristics of movement , length , and speed .
#Text=Depending on the size of the robot and its accessories , determine the maximum distance of the length and movement of the linear actuator .
#Text=Decide on the speed of the actuator and the amount of force it should place on the robotic components .
#Text=Install the Motor .
#Text=Choose a DC motor that can run on low torque and perform quick rotations at the same time .
#Text=You need to use the aluminum sheet to install the motor to the robot ’s body .
#Text=Drill two holes into the top left and bottom right hand corners of the sheet .
#Text=Drill two similar holes into the installation panel of the motor .
#Text=Then install the motor onto the robot with the fasteners .
#Text=Connect the Controllers .
#Text=First , connect the servo motor controller to the DC motor .
#Text=Then connect the servo controller to the micro controller .
#Text=This will provide the power supply to the robot and the actuator .
#Text=The micro controller will also help you to decide on the amount of power needed to run the robot and the actuator .
#Text=The servo motor controller is also used to ensure the correct amount of voltage for the linear actuator .
#Text=Install the Wheels .
#Text=The wheels are installed to the robot to simply provide fluid movement to the robot during the application .
#Text=Drill holes into the wheels and attach them to the robot and the motor .
#Text=Use the fasteners to install the wheels properly onto the devices .
#Text=Turn on the Motor .
#Text=Once the motor is turned on , you adjust the amount of power that you need for the application .
#Text=Generally , linear actuator comes with control boxes and remote controls that allow you to control the movement of the actuator .
#Text=Tips
#Text=For small robotic applications , you should use DC linear actuators .
#Text=They consist of a screw , which turns with the rotations of the motor , thus creating the necessary actuator movement .
#Text=If your application requires the robot to lift a heavy object , then pneumatic or hydraulic linear actuators would be the best choices .
#Text=These actuators are designed to provide long strokes and move at high speeds .
